Class Formula

    • Formula
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    And, CommonKnow, EveryKnows, ImplicitKnow, Know, Maybe, MemoizationFormula, MultiCommon, MultiEvery, MultiImplicit, Neg, Or, PrivateAnnouncement, PropVar, PublicAnnouncement

    public abstract class Formula
extends java.lang.Object
    Superclass for all Formulas

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract boolean evaluate(KripkeModel model,
                                 int state)
        Evaluate a Formula in a state using the given model
        Parameters:
        model - The model used for evaluation
        state - The state to evaluate the Formula in
        Returns:
        `true` if the Formula holds in state `state`, `false` otherwise

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(KripkeModel model)
        Evaluate a Formula in state 0 in the given model. State 0 is the true state.
        Parameters:
        model - The model used for evaluation
        Returns:
        `true` if the Formula evaluate in state 0, `false` otherwise

      • negate

        public Formula negate()
        Negate a formula. Preferred way of creating negations
        Returns:
        The negation of a formula

      • simplify

        public Formula simplify()
        Simplify a Formula for easier evaluation
        Returns:
        A logically equivalent, possibly simplified formula

      • memoize

        public Formula memoize()
        Make a formula remember its evaluation in a specific state. Do not use if you work with different models
        Returns:
        The memoized version of the formula

      • implies

        public static Formula implies(Formula premises,
                              Formula conclusion)
        Return an implication. Since there is no implies class, this convenience method was added.
        Parameters:
        premises - The premises of the implication
        conclusion - The conclusion of the implication
        Returns:
        The new implication

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string representation of this Formula
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation
